intro: Thottea praetermissa, commonly known as the slender thottea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Thottea praetermissa is often found in wetlands and is an important component of riparian ecosystems.
